x_l: The Securities and Exchange Commission on Thursday approved a rule requiring brokers to keep some information in a "lock box" where it cannot be accessed without the consent of the client. x_l: A Texas judge has ordered a Texas state trooper to turn over videotape and audio recordings showing a traffic stop of a black man who was accused of shoplifting. The order came in response to a Freedom of Information Act request filed by NBC News. The Texas Department of Public Safety refused to release the records and referred the matter to a county grand jury to determine if criminal charges should be filed against the trooper.
y_orig: The trooper, who has not been identified, has been on paid administrative leave since the incident.
y_summ: The trooper, who has not been identified, was suspended without pay after the incident.

x_l: For a long time, it was hard for me to believe that my mother had been killed in a car bomb. Then I realized that it was in Somalia, in the south of the country. For days, we were in a town near the Somalia-Somalia border, where thousands of Somalis in the area have fled since the terror group al-Shabab launched a suicide bombing last month at an army camp. "When the news came on TV on April 24, the first thing I thought of was my mother," said my father, who still lives in Kampala.

x_l: Two college freshmen have been arrested after a police chase through downtown Portland. They were charged with third-degree assault, reckless endangerment, reckless driving and failure to stop at the scene of an accident. A third juvenile was also arrested in connection with the crash but has not been charged. A police officer was hospitalized with a broken ankle. The crash occurred just before 4:00 a.m. Saturday, August 29, on Southeast Stark Street. According to Portland police, the three teens were driving recklessly and ran through a stop sign before crashing into a car.
y_orig: The driver of the car, a man in his 20s, was taken to the hospital with non-life threatening injuries.
y_summ: The driver of the car was transported to a local hospital with non-life-threatening injuries.

x_l: Texas Gov. Rick Perry says he will not seek another term as governor, a decision that effectively ends his six-year tenure. He said he did it to focus on his family. His comments on his presidential run and potential presidential run were widely criticized, and he lost the gubernatorial race.

x_l: Italian police said Tuesday that two people have been arrested in connection with the shooting death of a 15-year-old boy in front of his parents in the Tuscan city of Pian del Falco. The arrest was made after the body of one of the suspects, a 19-year-old man, was found on the outskirts of the town of Cervia, about 100 miles south of Rome. Police did not say whether the victim was the sole intended target of the shooting, but said the suspect had admitted to firing the shot that killed the teenager. The two suspects are believed to have fled the area and remain at large.

x_l: For five decades, Steve Jobs had an extraordinary habit of making mistakes that left some of his top executives scratching their heads. From his late-'60s mistakes with the Apple II to his bizarre, disastrous attempt to buy Pixar, Steve Jobs's greatest blunders came from both his great vision and his flawed decisions.
y_orig: In this fascinating new biography, Walter Isaacson traces the path of Steve Jobs from his childhood in rural Wisconsin to his rise to the top of Apple and beyond, and reveals how his mistakes led to the company's success.
y_summ: In this fascinating look at the man, the mistakes, and the lessons learned, author Walter Isaacson looks at the story of Apple's greatest visionary, from his humble beginnings in a garage to the company he created, and how he was ultimately undone by his own hubris.
